name: inex2ALTV
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: syl5eqel(cin(c2, c0), universe, cin(c0, c2), wcel(c0, c1))
stmt.pretty: syl5eqel((c2 ⋂ c0), universe, (c0 ⋂ c2), c0 ∈ c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cin(c2, c0), universe))
-| wceq(cin(c2, c0), cin(c0, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cin(c0, c2), universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cin(c2, c0), universe))
-| wceq(cin(c2, c0), cin(c0, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cin(c0, c2), universe))

|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cin(c2, c0), universe))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cin(c0, c2), universe))

comment: Sufficient condition for an intersection relation to be a set, see also ~ inex1g . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 19-Dec-2018.)
